text: Arthur Levitt Jr. (born February 3, 1931) is an American journalist and politician. He was the twenty-fifth and longest-serving Chairman of the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) from 1993 to 2001. Since May 2001 he has been employed as a senior adviser at the Carlyle Group.The Carlyle Group : Levitt, Arthur Levitt previously served as a policy advisor to Goldman Sachs and is a Director of Bloomberg LP, parent of Bloomberg News. ==References== Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:Jewish American politicians Category:Members of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Politicians from Brooklyn Category:Journalists from New York City Category:Writers from Brooklyn
title: Arthur Levitt
